Literature Review: The discovery of novel photocatalytic materials for efficient, selective, and robust energy conversion has gained significant attention in recent years. The Materials Genome Initiative has led to the development of materials databases, both computational and experimental, which have enabled the discovery of hundreds of photocatalysts for various chemical reactions. This review aims to summarize the data-driven photocatalyst discoveries, focusing on the methods and techniques developed to determine the (photo)electrochemical stability of photocatalysts, leading to the discovery of robust and durable materials for large-scale applications.
